datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: netgrp

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: netgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: netgrp

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: netgrp

header-client-ip.name: header-client-ip
header-client-ip.help: Action to take on the HTTP client-IP header in forwarded requests: forwards (pass), adds, or removes the HTTP header.

header-via-request.name: header-via-request
header-via-request.help: Action to take on the HTTP via header in forwarded requests: forwards (pass), adds, or removes the HTTP header.

header-via-response.name: header-via-response
header-via-response.help: Action to take on the HTTP via header in forwarded responses: forwards (pass), adds, or removes the HTTP header.

header-client-cert.name: header-client-cert
header-client-cert.help: Action to take on the HTTP Client-Cert/Client-Cert-Chain headers in forwarded responses: forwards (pass), adds, or removes the HTTP header.

header-x-forwarded-for.name: header-x-forwarded-for
header-x-forwarded-for.help: Action to take on the HTTP x-forwarded-for header in forwarded requests: forwards (pass), adds, or removes the HTTP header.

header-x-forwarded-client-cert.name: header-x-forwarded-client-cert
header-x-forwarded-client-cert.help: Action to take on the HTTP x-forwarded-client-cert header in forwarded requests: forwards (pass), adds, or removes the HTTP header.

header-front-end-https.name: header-front-end-https
header-front-end-https.help: Action to take on the HTTP front-end-HTTPS header in forwarded requests: forwards (pass), adds, or removes the HTTP header.

header-x-authenticated-user.name: header-x-authenticated-user
header-x-authenticated-user.help: Action to take on the HTTP x-authenticated-user header in forwarded requests: forwards (pass), adds, or removes the HTTP header.

header-x-authenticated-groups.name: header-x-authenticated-groups
header-x-authenticated-groups.help: Action to take on the HTTP x-authenticated-groups header in forwarded requests: forwards (pass), adds, or removes the HTTP header.

strip-encoding.name: strip-encoding
strip-encoding.help: Enable/disable stripping unsupported encoding from the request header.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable stripping of unsupported encoding from the request header.

options.description: Enable stripping of unsupported encoding from the request header

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable stripping of unsupported encoding from the request header.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable stripping of unsupported encoding from the request header

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable Enable/disable logging HTTP header changes.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable

options.label: Disable

dstaddr.name: dstaddr
dstaddr.help: Destination address and address group names.

dstaddr6.name: dstaddr6
dstaddr6.help: Destination address and address group names (IPv6).

action.name: action
action.help: Configure adding, removing, or logging of the HTTP header entry in HTTP requests and responses.

options.name: add-to-request
options.help: Add the HTTP header to request.
options.label: Add To Request

options.name: add-to-response
options.help: Add the HTTP header to response.
options.label: Add To Response

options.name: remove-from-request
options.help: Remove the HTTP header from request.
options.label: Remove From Request

options.name: remove-from-response
options.help: Remove the HTTP header from response.
options.label: Remove From Response

options.name: monitor-request
options.help: Record the HTTP header in utm-webfilter log.
options.label: Monitor Request

options.name: monitor-response
options.help: Record the HTTP header in utm-webfilter log.
options.label: Monitor Response

base64-encoding.name: base64-encoding
base64-encoding.help: Enable/disable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.
options.label: Disable

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.
options.label: Enable

add-option.name: add-option
add-option.help: Configure options to append content to existing HTTP header or add new HTTP header.

options.name: append
options.help: Append content to existing HTTP header or create new header if HTTP header is not found.
options.label: Append

options.name: new-on-not-found
options.help: Create new header only if existing HTTP header is not found.
options.label: New On Not Found

options.name: new
options.help: Create new header regardless if existing HTTP header is found or not.
options.label: New

options.name: replace
options.help: Replace content to existing HTTP header or create new header if HTTP header is not found.
options.label: Replace

options.name: replace-when-match
options.help: Replace content to existing HTTP header.
options.label: Replace When Match

protocol.name: protocol
protocol.help: Configure protocol(s) to take add-option action on (HTTP, HTTPS, or both).
